description: Senators in his own party expressed concern Sunday about the scathing report on North Carolina’s Republican gubernatorial nominee, Mark Robinson, acknowledging the grave allegations against Donald Trump’s preferred candidate.
title: Republican Lawmakers Raise Pressure on Mark Robinson Over Report

description: Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats appear to have held off a strong challenge from the far-right Alternative for Germany and look set to retain power in the eastern region of Brandenburg, sparing the chancellor and his party another embarrassing electoral setback.
title: Scholz’s SPD Leads in Brandenburg State Vote Ahead of Far Right

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is leading Donald Trump in two national polls of registered voters released Sunday, underscoring her momentum as the US presidential candidates grapple for a boost with early voting underway in several states.
title: Harris Shows Momentum in Two Polls While Swing States Stay Tight

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy urged allies to show “fortitude” in their support of Ukraine, as he sought to play down the threat of escalation over an upcoming decision to allow the country to use western weapons inside Russia.
title: UK Urges Western ‘Fortitude’ as Ukraine Awaits Missiles Decision

description: Israel said it carried out Saturday’s raid on Al Jazeera’s bureau in the West Bank after concluding that the news network’s offices there were “being used to incite terror.”
title: Israel Says Al Jazeera Offices ‘Being Used to Incite Terror’ After Bureau Raid

description: Sri Lanka’s leftist candidate won a tightly contested presidential election, with voters sweeping out the incumbent for the economic pain they’ve endured in the two years since the country was plunged into crisis.
title: Sri Lanka Leftist Wins Election After Vowing to Rejig IMF Deal

description: For months, the US has warned Iran not to send ballistic missiles to Russia and told China not to provide military components for Moscow’s war in Ukraine.
title: US Worries Deepen as Adversaries Team Up to Challenge Dominance

description: China’s power in Asia is plateauing at a level below the US as its economic capability is curtailed, according to the Lowy Institute’s annual analysis of influence in the region.
title: China’s Power in Asia Plateauing Below US, Lowy Institute Says

description: South Africa’s new government marks its 100th day in power on Sunday, and while the coalition has been credited with lifting market sentiment, it’s arguably President Cyril Ramaphosa’s earlier reforms that are driving the current optimism.
title: South African Unity Government at 100 Days Amid Market Optimism

description: President Emmanuel Macron’s new government sparked an immediate angry reaction from across the political spectrum, raising the risk of a swift collapse that would further cloud the outlook for France’s stretched public finances.
title: France’s Government Is at Risk as Opponents Eye a Censure Motion

description: Swiss voters rebuffed a government plan to reform company pension funds, marking the second time this year that a proposal to adapt the country’s retirement system to changed demographics was rejected in a plebiscite.
title: Swiss Voters Shoot Down Government’s Pension-Fund Reform

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer saw new questions over donations and gifts overshadow the start of his Labour Party’s annual conference in Liverpool, with top officials spending more time denying rule-breaking than touting the new UK government’s policy plans.
title: Starmer’s Political Rally Disrupted by Fresh Questions on Gifts

description: The exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah intensified on Sunday as the Lebanon-based group launched about 115 rockets, missiles and drones toward vast areas of Israel’s north.
title: Israel’s North Under Fire as Hezbollah Responds to Pager Attacks

description: A leading union is unveiling a series of billboards as part of its call on the Government to reverse its controversial cuts to winter fuel allowance.
title: Unite Billboard Campaign Urges Government to Reverse Winter Fuel Cuts

description: Almost a year after Hamas attacked southern Israel, triggering a punishing war in Gaza and upending regional geopolitics, concerns are growing that Palestinian militants could stage a similar incursion from the West Bank and provoke an even broader conflict.
title: Israelis Fear Attack From Restive West Bank Will Spark Wider War

description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) — Four people have died and more than 20 were wounded in a shooting in a nightlife area in Birmingham, Alabama, according to police and news reports.
title: Four Killed in Birmingham Late Night Shooting, Alabama Police Say

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un sent Chinese President Xi Jinping greetings with what appeared to be restrained rhetoric that comes as Pyongyang moves closer to Russia and depends less on its long-time Asian ally.
title: Kim Jong Un Offers Tepid Praise to China as He Cozies Up to Russia

description: Interim New York Police Department commissioner, Thomas Donlon, said federal agents searched his homes and seized materials unrelated to the department, according to a report from the New York Times.
title: Federal Agents Search Acting NYPD Commissioner’s Homes, NYT Says

description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is ending a brief US visit confident that two key regional security alliances will remain in place regardless of who wins the presidential election.
title: Australia PM Confident Aukus, Quad Will Endure After US Election

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats have ruled the eastern German region of Brandenburg since reunification in 1990, but their grip on power is under threat from the far-right Alternative for Germany in Sunday’s election in the former communist state.
title: German Chancellor Scholz Exposed in Regional Vote: What to Watch

description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Israeli troops raided the offices of the satellite news network Al Jazeera in the Israeli-occupied West Bank early Sunday, ordering the bureau to shut down amid a widening campaign by Israel targeting the Qatar-funded broadcaster as it covers the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip.
title: Israel Raids and Shuts Down Al Jazeera News Bureau in West Bank

description: A Sri Lankan leftist politician who’s pledged to fight corruption in the crisis-hit economy took a convincing early lead as votes were counted in Saturday’s presidential election.
title: Sri Lanka Leftist Candidate Takes Early Lead in Election Count

description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers said he expects upcoming data to show encouraging progress in combating inflation but acknowledged the central bank may not be ready to cut interest rates this week.
title: Australian Treasurer Expects to See Progress in Inflation Fight
